title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=ae6b7a10fa3272821e9904431dab0b993b36aae7
comments:
* Poker face
* South Park S26
* The Last of Us
great
great
nice
great
interesting
amazing
great
great
amazing

Came across a Russian film production studio called [Mosfilm](https://youtube.com/@Mosfilm_eng) on YouTube. There are several movies uploaded in this channel. I recently watched War and Peace and wanted to check if there are any other movies in this channel that are worth watching from Mosfilm(other than Tarkovsky's). I don't have any genre preference.

* Farzi
* Cunk on the earth
* The winning secrets (webseries)
Watched pawan kumar's kudi yedamaithe

Podcast - There's a new Indian science podcast called Imagined Tomorrow. Looks at the future, and quite well made.

TV series - The Night Manager, Indian adaptation is surprisingly good. Don't understand why they split it up into two chunks.
Any good non-Hindi Netflix/Amazon Prime worth watching? Looking for a series with subtitles. Open to all genres.
Do you recommend the Night Manager? How is the original series?

The original series is pretty good. Hugh Laurie is excellent. The Indian version has adapted to the South Asian context well, imo. But while the original is 6 episodes, the Indian one has been stretched out and made longer
Checkout Fauda. Ignore if watched already.
Watching The Bridge on Amazon Prime. Right now on the 7th episode of season 1 and so far seems pretty good.

Romance can be done in any life frames. We Indians are so romantic. But confused how to do that? Hello guys!, I found a video which is just meant for you. Go watch it! [Life romance](https://youtu.be/eejIaWW45Ig)
I loved the original series. Didn't know there was an Indian version will check it out. Thanks!
